03e8.comment: The registers in this instance is 03e8. By default, this is read from holding registers.
03e8.comment2:: To read from input registers add the field 'reg_type': 'input'

value.comment: NOTE: this object is a list, but does not have a 'separator' or a 'format' modifier.
value.comment2: This will return a list normally, but when paired with the 'exec' you can pass the
value.comment3: list items in to the exec string via python formatting, e.g. {}

value.comment: register value is number of days since Jan 1,1970. exec must output to the variable 'exec_out'
value.comment2: The exec string will be formatted (e.g. {}) with the modbus register value.
value.title: Service A Due Date

value.comment: register value is number of days since Jan 1,1970. exec must output to the variable 'exec_out'
value.comment2: The exec string will be formatted (e.g. {}) with the modbus register value.
value.title: Service B Due Date

buttons.title: Exercise Duration
buttons.comment: The command_sequence can be one or more commands

command_sequence.comment: 'reg' is the modbus register and is required. The value written to the register is supplied by the user.
command_sequence.comment2: 'input_title' is required. 'length' (number of modbus bytes to write) is 2 by default,but must be 2 or 4 if supplied.
command_sequence.comment3: 'bounds_reg' is optional but allows the user interface to bounds check the data before sending it to genmon (highly recommended)
command_sequence.comment4: 'tooltip' is optional but allows the user interface to display more information regarding the input.
command_sequence.tooltip: The duration of the exercise cycle. This must be a whole number between 12 and 60 minutes.
The delay between the loss of utility power and the cranking of the generator. This must be a whole number between 5 and 1500 seconds.
The delay between the start of the generator and the activation of the transfer switch when utility power has been lost. This must be a whole number between 2 and 1500 seconds.

The utility voltage that denotes an outage. Any utility voltage below this value will trigger the generator to start (After the Start Delay has expired). This must be a whole number between 0 and 342.
The utility voltage that denotes an outage is over.. This must be a whole number between 175 and 342.

fuel.comment: NOTE: this element will add a fuel gauge in addition to any defined in the gauges array
fuel.title: Fuel Sensor

datetime.comment: This entry is for displaying the time in a format similar to how genmon displays the system time of the system running genmon.
datetime.title: Generator Time

value.comment: NOTE: 0.00390625 = 1/256 or dividing by 0x100 hex or shifting right by 8 bits
value.title: Hours

settime.comment: the settime object, if present can enable writing of the date and time to the controller
settime.comment2: the 'command_sequence' list is required. It defines the registers and what to write to each register
settime.comment3: The hour,minute,month,date,year entries are like the 'exec' entries in that they are python code that
settime.comment4: format the date and time input into the formate expected in the modbus register.
settime.comment5: If multiple entries are in one register command object, the values will be logical OR'ed to create a single value

command_sequence.comment: This will take a four digit year and only use the lower two digits as low byte
This will write the day of the month to the lower byte and the month to the upper byte
command_sequence.comment2: The 'day' and 'month' will be OR'ed together to create one value to write to the register

command_sequence.comment: This will write the hours to the upper byte and minutes to the lower byte.
command_sequence.comment1: The 'hour' and 'minute' will be OR'ed together to create one value to write to the register

maintenance_due.comment: This should only return a value if maintenance is due, otherwise evaluate to nothing.
maintenance_due.title: Maintenance A Due
